intro: Pimpinella variifolia, commonly known as variable cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features compound leaves with varying leaflet shapes, contributing to its common name. Its small, yellowish flowers are typically arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Pimpinella variifolia is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
